channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some cities allow noncitizens to vote in local elections. Their turnout is quite low
item.description: Some cities, like three in Vermont, allow non-U.S. citizens to vote in local elections. In these places, noncitizen turnout has remained low, as noncitizen voting is a contentious national issue.
item.content:encoded:
Some cities, like three in Vermont, allow non-U.S. citizens to vote in local elections. In these places, noncitizen turnout has remained low, as noncitizen voting is a contentious national issue.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Mikaela Lefrak

item.title: She survived the 1970 Kent State shooting. Here's her message to student activists
item.description: On May 4, 1970, the Ohio National Guard fired on Kent State students, killing four and wounding nine. A former student who now teaches there reflects on that day and offers lessons for protesters now.
item.content:encoded: On May 4, 1970, the Ohio National Guard fired on Kent State students, killing four and wounding nine. A former student who now teaches there reflects on that day and offers lessons for protesters now.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: When PTO stands for 'pretend time off': Doctors struggle to take real breaks
item.description: What's a typical vacation activity for doctors? Work. A new study finds that most physicians do work on a typical day off. In this essay, a family doctor considers why that is and why it matters.
item.content:encoded:
What's a typical vacation activity for doctors? Work. A new study finds that most physicians do work on a typical day off. In this essay, a family doctor considers why that is and why it matters.

(Image credit: Wolfgang Kaehler)
item.dc:creator: Mara Gordon

item.title: Jerry Seinfeld and the fraught history of comedians and 'political correctness'
item.description: Jerry Seinfeld has the become the latest in a string of public figures to blame "political correctness" for the death of comedy (among other societal ills). But what does the term actually refer to?
item.content:encoded: Jerry Seinfeld has the become the latest in a string of public figures to blame "political correctness" for the death of comedy (among other societal ills). But what does the term actually refer to?
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella

item.title: Photos: Campus protests continue nationwide as some turned violent
item.description: Photojournalists at NPR member stations documented protests at college and university campuses nationwide this week.
item.content:encoded:
Photojournalists at NPR member stations documented protests at college and university campuses nationwide this week.

(Image credit: Michael Minasi)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: 'Dance Your Ph.D.' winner on science, art, and embracing his identity
item.description: Weliton Menário Costa's award-winning music video showcases his research on kangaroo personality and behavior — and offers a celebration of human diversity, too.
item.content:encoded: Weliton Menário Costa's award-winning music video showcases his research on kangaroo personality and behavior — and offers a celebration of human diversity, too.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Six months out from the election, Wisconsin students weigh voting for Biden
item.description: Wisconsin's young voters — who have turned out in big numbers in recent elections — are key for either candidate to win the state. But Biden is facing some skepticism on the state's college campuses.
item.content:encoded: Wisconsin's young voters — who have turned out in big numbers in recent elections — are key for either candidate to win the state. But Biden is facing some skepticism on the state's college campuses.
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: A seafood bounty lures sea lions to S.F.'s Pier 39 in numbers not seen in 15 years
item.description: It's a popular rest stop for sea lions, but the docks at the tourist hot spot these days are unusually packed out with the slippery residents. Conservationists are buoyed by the surge in visitors.
item.content:encoded:
It's a popular rest stop for sea lions, but the docks at the tourist hot spot these days are unusually packed out with the slippery residents. Conservationists are buoyed by the surge in visitors.

(Image credit: Godofredo A. Vásquez)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: After adopting its own Green New Deal, a college town sets a new target
item.description: Ithaca, N.Y., will require that 50% of the money spent on its energy transition and on major infrastructure projects is directed toward those residents most at risk from climate change.
item.content:encoded:
Ithaca, N.Y., will require that 50% of the money spent on its energy transition and on major infrastructure projects is directed toward those residents most at risk from climate change.

(Image credit: Aurora Berry)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Redelmeier

item.title: Houston area braces for flooding to worsen following storms
item.description: A flood watch remained in effect through Sunday afternoon as forecasters predicted additional rainfall Saturday night, bringing another 1 to 3 inches of water to the soaked region.
item.content:encoded:
A flood watch remained in effect through Sunday afternoon as forecasters predicted additional rainfall Saturday night, bringing another 1 to 3 inches of water to the soaked region.

(Image credit: Raquel Natalicchio)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
